author: Amy
text:
Hit or Miss. 

I was a bit nervous to place my first order with the Real Real. I decided to splurge on a few pieces that I could use for my new job. I ordered three items-- a full grey suit, a black skirt, and a green blouse.

Grey Suit: The suit jacket was perfect BUT the matching skirt had holes in it (along the back seam of the skirt). No where in the listing were holes mentioned, in fact, the description made it sound like the suit was practically brand new. Obviously it would have been helpful to know that the item had holes in it. (Had I known, I would have gone with something else.) 

Black Skirt: The black skirt was also a bit of a let down. The skirt turned out to have two layers (this was not mentioned in the listing)--an outer layer and a inner layer. The outer layer is a tweed wool material, and the inner layer is a silky material. The measurements provided on the listing were for the OUTER layer-- not the INNER layer. (The inner layer is about two inches smaller than the outer layer.) Long story short, the skirt does not fit. I am disappointed. Again, had I known, I would have gone with something else. 

Green Blouse was perfect. I was 100% satisfied with the blouse. 

Overall, don't expect to get something that you will be able to wear right out of the box. The items may be measured incorrectly (or maybe it would be more accurate to say incompletely), and contain surprise damage like holes.
title: Hit or Miss

author: Mrs McGowan
text:
The RealReal is a U.S based online consignment site for designer clothing, accessories and other luxury items.  
I've made only one purchase of a specific designer eyeglass case which I received promptly, in excellent condition and as listed on the site. Upon browsing the site and with the variety of items listed, I have no doubt to expect anything different on other purchases as to condition and quality.

However, I was disappointed in the customer service aspect of my purchase. The timeframe given to change, modify or cancel a purchase is very limited and unreasonably so with a weekend purchase. Connecting to a live agent, was very difficult and when I finally did, the timeframe had expired.  Efficiency in processing orders, shouldn't supersede good customer service, in my opinion
title: The RealReal: Designer Consignment Online

author: Jennifer
text: I searched high and low for the perfect leather jacket and finally found it on The Real Real. Sadly, I was sent the wrong item (somebody else's perfect jacket, I imagine). I found the customer service chat people to be polite, but ultimately unhelpful in fixing the issue. The most frustrating part was that I had to eat the $45 I paid in duties and never received the item I originally ordered.

author: customer
text: I received the wrong item. I ordered an ivory sweater, and received a mustard yellow tank top instead. Not even remotely similar? I also ordered a red tank top in “excellent condition”. When I got the item and pulled it out of the box, it was completely covered in dust/dirt. It looked like it had been sitting on some warehouse floor and people had been walking all over it for years. Aside from rumored authenticity issues for high-price items, TheRealReal clearly lacks proper responsibility and ability to store, organize, and ship items so that they are correct and in the best possible conditions. I assume some items will have snags/not be in pristine condition as this is a consignment store, but to deliver an item that is coated in dirt clearly from their own facilities, or ship a completely different item than ordered is unacceptable.
title: Terrible Experience
